bestBHT.bht: Our adoption is already a reality, as the Holy Spirit dwells within us and serves as the earnest of our complete possession by Him. While we do not wait for our adoption, we eagerly anticipate the day when our bodies will be redeemed from corruption and sin, thereby achieving the full manifestation of our adoption. The redemption of our bodies is the ultimate goal, signifying the complete redemption of both our soul and body, a fulfillment that we anxiously await.

Henry Alford: the indwelling and influences of the Holy Spirit here, as an earnest of the full harvest of His complete possession of us, spirit and flesh and soul hereafter.
our adoption is come already, ver. 15, so that we do not wait for it, but for the full manifestation of it, in our bodies being rescued from the bondage of corruption and sin
the [entire] redemption, rescue, of the body from corruption and sin
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: the Spirit as the first-fruits of our full redemption
though we have so much of heaven already within us
waiting for the... redemption of our body-from the grave
Albert Barnes: The word used ἀπαρχὴ aparchē denotes properly the first-fruits of the harvest, the portion that was first collected and consecrated to God as an offering of gratitude.
The Spirit had been sent down to attend the preaching of the gospel, and they were among the first who had partaken of those influences.

The hope of being acknowledged in the presence of the universe as the child of God - the hope of the poorest and the humblest believer - is of infinitely more value than the prospect of the most princely inheritance, or of the brightest crown that a monarch ever wore.
John Calvin: The excellency of our glory is of such importance even to the very elements, which are destitute of mind and reason, that they burn with a certain kind of desire for it; how much more it behoves us, who have been illuminated by the Spirit of God, to aspire and strive with firmness of hope and with ardour of desire, after the attainment of so great a benefit.

He would have them to be raised up with the expectation of their future blessedness, and by an elevation of mind to overcome all their present miseries, while they consider not what they are now, but what they are to be.

The eternal decree of God, by which he has chosen us to himself as sons before the foundation of the world, of which he testifies to us in the gospel, the assurance of which he seals on our hearts by his Spirit, would be void, except the promised resurrection were certain, which is its consummation.
Philip Schaff: Even Christians who are highly privileged unite with creation in its groaning.
Though we have the first-fruits of the Spirit, our salvation is incomplete; the groaning is internal and intense.
The redemption is not complete until the body is redeemed: then we shall have the full blessing of adoption.
Archibald T. Robertson: The Holy Spirit came on the great Pentecost and his blessings continue as seen in the 'gifts' in Romans 8:1, in the moral and spiritual gifts of Galatians 5:22."
And greater ones are to come (1 Corinthians 15:44)."
Then we shall have complete redemption of both soul and body.
John Gill: grace is of the same kind with glory, and is a pledge and earnest of it
groans were inward from their hearts, not hypocritical or were among themselves, common to them all
their groans were...for the conversion of the Gentiles...for which they incessantly laboured, and prayed night and day
John Wesley: And even we, who have the first-fruits of the Spirit."
So at the general resurrection, when the body itself is redeemed from death, the sons of God shall be publicly owned by him in the great assembly of men and angels.
The redemption of our body — From corruption to glory and immortality.

bhtAttempts.bht: Our adoption, sealed by the indwelling and influences of the Holy Spirit, is already a reality. However, we eagerly await the full manifestation of it when our bodies are delivered from the bondage of corruption and sin. The redemption of our body is the final culmination of our complete redemption - a promise that the Spirit as the first-fruits of our redemption assures us. While we have experienced a taste of heaven within us, we long for the complete redemption of both soul and body. This redemption, eagerly awaited, is a hope that even creation joins us in, as it groans for the day of complete restoration.

Our adoption is already a reality, confirmed by the Holy Spirit's presence within us. Yet, we eagerly anticipate the full manifestation of this adoption when our bodies are redeemed from corruption and sin. The redemption of our body is the ultimate culmination of our complete redemption, which we can already sense through the first-fruits of the Spirit. While we have already experienced the blessings of heaven within us, we yearn for the complete redemption of both our souls and bodies. This longing is shared by creation itself, which also groans for the day of restoration.

Our adoption is already a reality, as the Holy Spirit dwells within us and serves as the earnest of our complete possession by Him. While we do not wait for our adoption, we eagerly anticipate the day when our bodies will be redeemed from corruption and sin, thereby achieving the full manifestation of our adoption. The redemption of our bodies is the ultimate goal, signifying the complete redemption of both our soul and body, a fulfillment that we anxiously await.

Our adoption has already taken place, as evidenced by the indwelling and influences of the Holy Spirit. However, we are still awaiting the full manifestation of our adoption, which occurs when our bodies are redeemed from corruption and sin. This redemption of our bodies represents the ultimate fulfillment of our complete redemption. While we already possess a glimpse of heaven within us, there is a yearning for the complete redemption of our soul and body. Even creation itself joins in this longing, as it groans for the day of restoration.

Our adoption is already a reality, sealed by the indwelling and influences of the Holy Spirit. However, we eagerly await the full manifestation of our adoption, when our bodies will be rescued from the bondage of corruption and sin. This redemption of our bodies signifies the ultimate completion of our salvation. While we have experienced a foretaste of heavenly blessings within us, our souls long for the full redemption of both our spirit and physical bodies. This hope is shared by creation, which groans for its own restoration.
